anti-corporate militants whose
activities shade from Frankish agitprop
to outright terrorism in his review AO
scott rights in general the east is a
bit more persuasive on the psychology of
its characters than on the politics of
their actions communicating a sense of
ambient vulnerability that extends from
the individuals on screen into the very
universe they inhabit but their animus
is also explained in ways that strain
credibility and undermine the film's
topicality it may however be asking too
much of the east to wish that it would
frame the contradictions of contemporary
capitalism more rigorously the movie is
aware that they exist and wishes they
could be resolved more or less happily
which is hard to argue with though also
